title: Camulet

properties.value: Camulet is a reward from Enakhra's Lament. When equipped, its wearer can speak to certain camels found in Al Kharid and throughout the Kharidian desert.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Camulet
Camulet

Item ID6707

Camulet is a reward from Enakhra's Lament. When equipped, its wearer can speak to certain camels found in Al Kharid and throughout the Kharidian desert.

The Camulet has four charges to teleport to the desert, inside Enakhra's Temple near Lazim. With the hard Desert Diary completed, the teleport destination can be switched to the temple entrance near the quarry.

Using the Camulet to teleport to Enakhra's Temple is a requirement for the Medium Desert Diary.

To recharge the Camulet, players must use a bucket of Ugthanki dung on it. Players can receive dung by speaking to certain camels (after partial completion of My Arm's Big Adventure) while wearing the Camulet, such as Al the Camel, who can be found outside the bank in Al Kharid. You'll also need a bucket to collect the dung.

If lost, it can be retrieved by speaking with Lazim. Multiple Camulets may be obtained using the drop trick, but when a charge on one is consumed it is subtracted from all Camulets in the player's possession (similar to the way ring of recoil charges work).

The player can pay Lazim 1,000,000 coins to have him enhance the Camulet to allow unlimited teleport charges. The upgrade is permanent and will take effect on other Camulets in the player's possession and on replacements given by Lazim should the player lose one.

Teleportation options[edit | edit source]

Destination Map
Inside Enakhra's Temple
Bandit Camp Quarry[1]
  1. ↑ This option can be used after the completion of the hard Desert Diary

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
8 October 2015
(update)

Split the worn teleport options on the Camulet when the desert diary teleports have been unlocked.

6 August 2015
(update)

It is no longer possible to waste Ugthanki dung attempting to recharge the Camulet when it is already fully charged.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

You can now change the Camulet teleport location to the cavern entrance of Enakhra's Temple if you have completed the Desert Hard Diary.

[[File:Camulet detail.png|left|150px]]
'''Camulet''' is a reward from [[Enakhra's Lament]]. When equipped, its wearer can speak to certain [[camels]] found in [[Al Kharid]] and throughout the Kharidian desert.

The Camulet has four charges to teleport to the desert, inside [[Enakhra's Temple]] near [[Lazim]]. With the hard [[Desert Diary]] completed, the teleport destination can be switched to the temple entrance near the [[Bandit Camp Quarry|quarry]].

Using the Camulet to teleport to Enakhra's Temple is a requirement for the [[Medium Desert Diary]].

To recharge the Camulet, players must use a [[bucket]] of [[Ugthanki dung]] on it. Players can receive dung by speaking to certain camels (after partial completion of [[My Arm's Big Adventure]]) while wearing the Camulet, such as [[Al the Camel]], who can be found outside the bank in [[Al Kharid]]. You'll also need a [[bucket]] to collect the dung.

If lost, it can be retrieved by speaking with [[Lazim]]. Multiple Camulets may be obtained using the [[drop trick]], but when a charge on one is consumed it is subtracted from all Camulets in the player's possession (similar to the way [[ring of recoil]] charges work).

The player can pay [[Lazim]] 1,000,000 coins to have him enhance the Camulet to allow unlimited teleport charges. The upgrade is permanent and will take effect on other Camulets in the player's possession and on replacements given by Lazim should the player lose one.
